name: Waldorf Celestion Apartment Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Celestion Waldorf Apartment Hotel in Auckland, NZ. We stayed two nights.
reviews.title: Waldorf Celestion Apt Auckland
Don't let entrance fool you...great place!
reviews.text: Very spacious, clean, centrally located, and affordable when booked on line. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Free WiFi is always a bonus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2 bedroom apartment with mini kitchen and living room. There is a self serve laundry on site, which came in handy.
reviews.title: Amazing Apartment for the same price as tiny hotel room!!

reviews.text: The area surrounding the hotel is a little dodgy, but no issues. There are other Waldorf hotels nearby. I recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: really enjoyed our stay!

reviews.text: Our stay was march 16th for two nights, but just getting around to writing review. When we first pulled up to this place we thought oh no:(.... But to our surprise and relief the staff was wonderful and the apartment was just what we wanted and needed. The view from our balcony was great and the bed was comfortable. Kitchen adequate and shopping just down the street for groceries. Everything was walking distance for us and the hotel even arranged airport shuttle for us at a reduced rate with a private taxi. The taxi driver we had was a treat. My husband and him had a conversation all the way to the airport about cars and such. Alan enjoyed this so therefore I was happy. I would recommend this place for anyone who wants to cook for he selves and save some money. We were n the seventh floor and view nice.
reviews.title: Amazing apartments
Spacious and comfortable - Parking a bit of a nightmare though!
reviews.text: We stayed in a two bedroom one bathroom apartment on the 12th floor facing the back,, The room was quiet, well appointed, clean and had a kitchenette with electric hob, fridge and microwave. We didn't cook but had breakfast there and it was fine. The room has air conditioing in the living are but not eh bedrooms. There is also an in room safe and communal laundry facilites (not in room). Internet is charged at $8 per day for 1Gb and goes up from there - you can buy for a whole week, Notice I say internet and not WiFi - if you want WiFi you need to get a router from reception and the weekend I was there they were all given out. So I had to use the ethernet cable that they supply in the room and didn't have WiFi for the 2 days we were there. Funnily enough whoever stayed in the room before me had bought a one week internet package and I was allowed to use the rest of the remaining allowance and didn't have to pay for internet usage - so check before you buy!

reviews.title: Excellent, spacious, centrally located hotel
reviews.text: The reception staff were friendly and immediately attended to any requests we had and even helped us load our car in the morning. So overall it was a pleasant and comfortable stay apart from one thing.....the car parking. There is limited car parking on site and you need to reserve in advance - I did but even so the spaces were all gone. The hotel is on the main street and you cannot stop outside the hotel. You need to pull into the alleyway by the hotel which leads to their limited car park spaces. This alleyway is tight and you need to pull in far left to allow users of the car park to get in and out. Also if more than 2 people are checking in then the alley is full. Once you have unloaded your luggage and checked in, you need to move your car immediately. Luckily I arrived late on Saturday night and was checking out Monday morning at 7am. So between those hours you can park on Emily Place (just behind the hotel) at the meters for free. But check which bays you park in as some are residents only and don't stray into the CBD where the meters are active until 10pm 7 days a week. If you're not lucky enough to arrive at that time of the week you then have to park at a car park 5 minutes away which is not exactly handy. The other snag I encountered was that I arrived on the evening of a concert at Vector Arena so finding a spot was a nightmare and I ended up having to park 1 kilometer away.

reviews.title: A decent family palce in Auckland
reviews.text: For me the car park challenge was not an issue as I had time to spare but be warned that this is a problem. Otherwise it s a comfortable pleasant hotel with good facilities.

reviews.title: great one
reviews.text: The outside of the building is unassuming and camouflaged, and the lobby has a bit of a shabby chic feel going on. The two executive studio apartments that we rented however were bright and shiny and new and wonderful. There was so much space - a study, full kitchen, dining table, couch, separated bedroom, balcony and a large bathroom. The hotel was just across the road from the shopping district and waterfront with loads of eating options and a huge supermarket. Highly recommended base to explore Auckland.

reviews.title: Great short stay apartments
reviews.text: We rented a 2 bedroom appartment for a couple of nights and were pleased with the quality and tidyness of the appartment. Access is a bit painfull via a small side road with heavy slope and stairs, so unloading/loading the luggage was a bit of a struggle. The hotel is walking distance from teh city centre, even with 3 little kids.

We stayed at the Celestion Waldorf for one night as it was very close to where we were going for an event. The 2 bedroom apartment was a good size with one queen and 2 single beds. The shower was large and it had all the other amenities you would expect. Everthing was clean and in working order. We parked on a side road (Short St) for $2 overnight as it was free parking after 6pm and on Sunday. The front desk staff were pleasant. It's close to Britomart and some excellent restaurants... we had a fantastic meal at Mexico.
reviews.title: Good apartment. Comfy beds!

reviews.text: If you want a good location and spacious apartment with kitchen thesis for you. I was there for 2 weeks and it was great. 2 hobs and a microwave, big fridge and freezer. Separate bedroom. You can use the pool over the road at Scene 2 apartments and location superb very close to new britomart district.
reviews.title: Business 2 week stay

reviews.text: The only downside was the cleaning and rubbish bins. I only had 2 cleans over the fortnight and somedays I emptied the rubbish bin and the bag wasn't replaced for 2 days. My recommendation for the hotel is that they at least check you have a rubbish bag in your bin.
reviews.title: Nice 2 bedroom apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was great. It had a big balcony which we could see the harbour from, with chairs and a table to sit at. The kitchenette came with all the set up to make our own meal. No oven but a microwave/convection oven. Nice bathroom. We used the fitness center across the street which was included. The laundry room downstairs was a reasonable $2 per load and the machine automatically added the detergent and fabric softener. There was a nice Indian restaurant downstairs. Unloading the luggage was tricky but manageable. The location was within walking distance to the mall and many restaurants.
reviews.title: January 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night on two separate occasion in one week due to our travelling. As stated not easy to access and unload, but Auckland traffic isn't London! we did resent the extraordinary fee for overnight parking though of $25, and no free wifi .... but this hotels we found vs. motels or B@B
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the entrance......great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel,with modern,spacious,beautifully appointed rooms.Our room was on the 14th floor overlooking Anzac Ave and could only be described as luxurious.It was large, had a huge balcony and had every modern convenience and more.The location is excellent,only 10 mins. walk to the harbour or city centre.Excellent eating places all around the hotel,with an excellent Indian restaurant on the premises.Reception service was excellent,nothing too much trouble.I don't think you could do better in Central Auckand and for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: A quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have been prepared to rate this hotel/apartments as excellent except there was no onsite parking available for our two night stay. Not being familiar with the Auckland CBD finding the nearest parking building was a hassle on the Friday evening.
reviews.title: Close to being excellent

reviews.text: The hotel is easy walking to Queen Street, the ferries, the bus terminal, the trendy Britomart shopping centre and a large supermarket.
reviews.title: Spacious luxury apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a two bedroom apartment which faced the main Street. (Traffic noise was not a problem) The apartment had a modern styling and was complete with a kitchenette.
reviews.title: Great weekend in Auckland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights at the beginning of March. The apartment was well laid out, containing a lovely bathroom, study, bedroom and kitchenette which included a electric hob, microwave, fridge and dishwasher. Very clean throughout with crisp white linen.
reviews.title: Super Nice Hotel in a Great Location

aka: Waldorf Celestion Apartment Hotel Auckland, New Zealand
description: Waldorf Celestion Hotel Apartments is perfectly positioned to take advantage of city living at its best. Nestled in a peaceful retreat yet only a few minute’s walk from Auckland’s waterfront & the hustle & bustle of the central city.Spacious one & two bedroom apartments over eighteen levels offer breathtaking views over Auckland city & out to the Hauraki Gulf. This 4.5-star stylish urban designed hotel apartment opened in May 2010 & provides luxurious accommodation from one night upwards with serviced & un-serviced options available.We are located near the corner of Anzac Ave & Beach Road, close to some of Auckland’s major commercial & entertainment areas. Situated on a strategic central Auckland site, Celestion Apartments Hotel is located just minutes from Auckland’s new 12,000 seat indoor Vector Arena stadium & 5 minute walk from Queen Street the heart of Auckland’s CBD. Just around the corner from Celestion is the 24 hour Countdown Supermarket. Just to the west of this is the new Britomart precinct & Auckland’s Transport Centre. Celestion has great secure parking facilities to offer guest with Wilson’s, Arena & Britomart car parks nearby. The choice is the guests’. The Hotel's central location and its proximity to most of Auckland's attractions and business activities make it suitable for those looking for short term or extended stays.
